metadata.title: CVE-2018-8004 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: There are multiple HTTP smuggling and cache poisoning issues when clientsmaking malicious requests interact with Apache Traffic Server (ATS). Thisaffects versions 6.0.0 to 6.2.2 and 7.0.0 to 7.1.3. To resolve this issueusers running 6.x should upgrade to 6.2.3 or later versions and 7.x usersshould upgrade to 7.1.4 or later versions.

criterions.comment: trafficserver: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
